answers.answer: Hi!  I'm not a medical professional, just the parent of a kid with diabetes.  A normal, healthy person will have a blood sugar range between 70 and 120, with possible spikes after meals.  A 116 score is a normal score, in my opinion, and nothing to worry about.  If you are concerned, however, getting that test done with your doctor is a way to ease concerns, and with your family history, regular blood sugar checks wouldn't be a bad idea.  Good luck.

question: I am a thirty yaer old women with a history of diabetes in my family .  Everyone on my fathers side of the family takes insulin i took a glucose test today from my grandmothers machine and it was 116 but i just finished eating about 10-15 minutes prior and was wondering if i should get tested with my doctor?  I took a glucose test in my early 20's but my grand mother told me that she didn't start getting symtoms until her 40's .
title: diabetes in adults
